text: Custom module rich text elements (as of v2) are still not supporting Smart Content, correct?
custom module rich text fields have never supported smart content and correct they still do not
it’s a heavily requested feature and something they’ve been trying to figure out how to do properly - with how complex custom modules can be it’s not trivial to make smart content possible in them
the unfortunate workaround is to have to use the default rich text module that comes with HubSpot, for that text
Agh -- some forum posts led me to believe otherwise. Thanks for the clarification. Any yeah, the complexity behind it, I'm sure, is intense.

yea, because there’s a bunch of different ways they could handle it (indivudal fields could be smart and have conditions, or the whole module could be smart and have conditions as a whole.

The interface could get really complicated
tl;dr - It is hard. We are working on it. Focused on how to report on Smart Content which will help us figure out the best way to implement.
Inbound 2019? :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
:wewillsee-nopromises:
haha
#illbeabetatester

Does anyone know how to turn *off* autoplay on a HubSpot/Vidyard integration video in rich text module? It looks like the module uses HubL to pull in the video.
Link to website page using video --> <https://www.onemint.co/2018/new-ui> (it's the 3rd video on the page - trying out a few different player module options).

ahh, just an FYI I figured out what’s up. The documentation is linking to your dev version of the docs I think.
All set, thanks!
Was this link on the same page as above?
Yes, under “Using elif and else”
